body.p:
Office of Adjutant General
Frankfort, Ky., Dec 19t, 1860.
Sir

By authority from the Governor of Ky I am authorised to order into the State armory the piece of Ordenance which was to you as the Inspector General Buckner concludes Artillery and Infantry in the same company is in compatable by the law

I am requested to say to you by the Quarter Master General West that so soon as we received from the amory at St Louis Musket which we will get from there in a few days he will exchange a fine musket for your Halls Rifles Inclosed by mail you will find a new manual for the use of
arms

I am with Respect
Your ObSt
Scott Brown

To
Capt E H Hobson
Greensburg
doo not send the gun knowing that Genl Buckner was a Rebel and to send the gun Smith
